block.p: It wouldn't be proper to address him as Sir Cyrus, but CYRUS R. VANCE, the former Secretary of State and international mediator, received the insignia of Honorary Knight Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire last night. The honor was bestowed upon him by Sir ROBIN RENWICK, the British Ambassador, at a black-tie dinner at the British Embassy in Washington.

It wouldn't be proper to address him as Sir Cyrus, but CYRUS R. VANCE, the former Secretary of State and international mediator, received the insignia of Honorary Knight Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire last night. The honor was bestowed upon him by Sir ROBIN RENWICK, the British Ambassador, at a black-tie dinner at the British Embassy in Washington.

Among the 100 or so guests were Warren Christopher, the Secretary of State; Sen. Claiborne Pell, the Democrat of Rhode Island, who is the chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee; Peter Tarnoff, an Undersecretary of State; Winston Lord, Assistant Secretary of State for Asian affairs; Lloyd Cutler, White House counsel, and Lord Owen, who has worked with Mr. Vance in efforts to settle the Bosnian conflict.
